event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A fatal clock distribution error was detected by an ASIC or a CPU chip.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
This message indicates a diagnosis of a fatal clock distribution error
being detected by an ASIC or a CPU chip.  

The ASIC or CPU chip that detected the clock distribution error can be
identified from the FMRI of the affected resource in the fault.


   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:

      If the clock distribution error is detected by a CPU chip,
        then the domain is reset and the CPU chip is deconfigured, and the domain becomes unbootable.

      If the clock distribution error is detected by a JSC chip,
        then the domain is reset, all DIMMs are deconfigured, and the domain becomes unbootable.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:

      If the clock distribution error is detected by a CPU chip,
        then a single domain using the CPU chip is reset and the CPU chip is deconfigured.
         
      If the clock distribution error is detected by a MAC chip,
        then all domains are reset and 8 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip are deconfigured.

      If the clock distribution error is detected by an SC chip,
        then all domains are reset and the platform become unbootable.
 


   SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:

      If the clock distribution error is detected by a CPU chip,
        then a single domain using the CPU chip is reset and the CPU chip is deconfigured.

      If the clock distribution error is detected by a MAC chip,
        then all domains are reset and 8 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip are deconfigured.

      If the clock distribution error is detected by an SC chip,
        then all domains are reset and 1/2 of the motherboard and its associated I/O is deconfigured.
 


   SPARC Enterprise M8000 platform:

      If the clock distribution error is detected by a CPU chip,
        then a single domain using the CPU chip is reset and the CPU chip is deconfigured.

      If the clock distribution error is detected by a MAC chip,
        then all domains using CMU are reset and 16 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip are deconfigured.
 
      If the clock distribution error is detected by an SC chip,
        then the domains in for the CMU associated with the SC chip are reset,
        and the CMU along with its associated I/O is deconfigured,
        Additionally, other domains on the platform may be reset.

 

   SPARC Enterprise M9000 platforms:

      If the clock distribution error is detected by a CPU chip,
        then a single domain using the CPU chip is reset and the CPU chip is deconfigured.

      If the clock distribution error is detected by a MAC chip,
        then all domains using CMU are reset and 16 DIMMs associated with the MAC chip are deconfigured.

      If the clock distribution error is detected by an SC chip,
        then the domains in for the CMU associated with the SC chip are reset,
        and the CMU along with its associated I/O is deconfigured,
        Additionally, other domains on the platform may be reset.
 
      If the clock distribution error is detected by an XB chip,
        then the entire platform is reset and a crossbar way deconfigured.

           If this is the first crossbar way being deconfigured,
             then the platform will operate with reduced performance.

           If a crossbar way has already been deconfigured,
             then the platform will be powered down.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU's.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 27 14:47:08 nwk-dc2-1-sc0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: nwk-dc2-1  
   EVENT-ID: c1bc7ddf-f865-4617-a1bd-91600af7d4de
   Refer to %FMAURL%/ SCF-8000-1D for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID:  SCF-8000-1D, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 14:47:07 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: nwk-dc2-1, HOSTNAME: nwk-dc2-1-sc0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: c1bc7ddf-f865-4617-a1bd-91600af7d4de
   DESC: A fatal clock distribution error was detected by an ASIC or a CPU chip.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8000-1D for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: An attempt will be made to deconfigure the faulty components after one
   or more domains are reset.
   IMPACT: One or more domains will be reset. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for
   additional information.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command


   SPARC Enterprise platform example:

   xscf> fmdump -v -u c1bc7ddf-f865-4617-a1bd-91600af7d4de

        TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
        Mar 27 14:47:07.3811 c1bc7ddf-f865-4617-a1bd-91600af7d4de SCF-8000-1D
          66%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.if.fe-asic-clk

               Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/cpu=0
                     Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/cpu=0
                         FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                                           server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0640S689:
                                           part=CA06620-D021 A6:revision=0201/component=/CMU#0/CPUM#0

          33%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.if.fe-asic-clk

               Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0
                     Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/cpu=0
                         FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=nwk-dc2-1:
                                           server-id=nwk-dc2-1-sc0:serial=PP0640T692:
                                           part=CA06620-D001 A8:revision=0101/component=/CMU#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.


If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: One or more domains will be reset. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: An attempt will be made to deconfigure the faulty components after one or more domains are reset.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Fatal clock distribution error detected by an ASIC or a CPU chip.
